sn51.14:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.
sn51.14:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother in the Eastern Monastery.

sn51.14:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū heṭṭhāmigāramātupāsāde viharanti uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā bhantacittā pākatindriyā.
sn51.14:1.3.eng: Now at that time several mendicants were staying beneath the longhouse. They were restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.

sn51.14:2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ āmantesi:
sn51.14:2.1.eng: Then the Buddha addressed Venerable Mahāmoggallāna,

sn51.14:2.2.pli: “ete kho, moggallāna, sabrahmacārino heṭṭhāmigāramātupāsāde viharanti uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā bhantacittā pākatindriyā.
sn51.14:2.2.eng: “These spiritual companions of yours staying beneath the longhouse are restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.

sn51.14:2.3.eng: Go, Moggallāna, and strike awe in those mendicants!”

sn51.14:3.1.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavato paṭissutvā tathārūpaṃ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkhāresi yathā pādaṅguṭṭhakena migāramātupāsādaṃ saṅkampesi sampakampesi sampacālesi.
sn51.14:3.1.eng: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahāmoggallāna. Then he used his psychic power to make the longhouse shake and rock and tremble with his big toe.

sn51.14:3.2.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū saṃviggā lomahaṭṭhajātā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu:
sn51.14:3.2.eng: Then those mendicants stood to one side, shocked and awestruck.

sn51.14:3.4.pli: Nivātañca vata ayañca migāramātupāsādo gambhīranemo sunikhāto acalo asampakampī, atha ca pana saṅkampito sampakampito sampacālito”ti.
sn51.14:3.4.eng: There’s no wind at all; and this stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother has deep foundations. It’s firmly embedded, imperturbable and unshakable. And yet it shakes and rocks and trembles!”

sn51.14:4.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū bhagavā etadavoca:
sn51.14:4.1.eng: Then the Buddha went up to those mendicants and said:

sn51.14:4.2.pli: “kiṃ nu tumhe, bhikkhave, saṃviggā lomahaṭṭhajātā ekamantaṃ ṭhitā”ti?
sn51.14:4.2.eng: “Why do you, mendicants, stand to one side, shocked and awestruck?”

sn51.14:4.4.pli: Nivātañca vata ayañca migāramātupāsādo gambhīranemo sunikhāto acalo asampakampī, atha ca pana saṅkampito sampakampito sampacālito”ti.
sn51.14:4.4.eng: There’s no wind at all; and this stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother has deep foundations. It’s firmly embedded, imperturbable and unshakable. And yet it shakes and rocks and trembles!”

sn51.14:4.5.pli: “Tumheva kho, bhikkhave, saṃvejetukāmena moggallānena bhikkhunā pādaṅguṭṭhakena migāramātupāsādo, saṅkampito sampakampito sampacālito.
sn51.14:4.5.eng: “Wanting to strike awe in you, the mendicant Moggallāna made the longhouse shake and rock and tremble with his big toe.

sn51.14:4.7.pli: katamesaṃ dhammānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo”ti?
sn51.14:4.7.eng: What things has the mendicant Moggallāna developed and cultivated so as to have such power and might?”

sn51.14:4.8.pli: “Bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā, bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. Sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃyeva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. Bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
sn51.14:4.8.eng: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and our refuge. Sir, may the Buddha himself please clarify the meaning of this. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

sn51.14:5.2.pli: Catunnaṃ kho, bhikkhave, iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo.
sn51.14:5.2.eng: The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.14:5.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, moggallāno bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.14:5.4.eng: Moggallāna develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.14:5.8.pli: iti me vīmaṃsā na ca atilīnā bhavissati, na ca atippaggahitā bhavissati;
sn51.14:5.8.eng: He thinks: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

sn51.14:5.9.pli: na ca ajjhattaṃ saṅkhittā bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhittā bhavissati.

sn51.14:5.10.eng: And he meditates perceiving before and behind:

sn51.14:5.11.pli: yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure;
sn51.14:5.11.eng: as before, so behind; as behind, so before;

sn51.14:5.12.pli: yathā adho tathā uddhaṃ, yathā uddhaṃ tathā adho;
sn51.14:5.12.eng: as below, so above; as above, so below;

sn51.14:5.13.pli: yathā divā tathā rattiṃ, yathā rattiṃ tathā divā.
sn51.14:5.13.eng: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.

sn51.14:5.14.pli: Iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
sn51.14:5.14.eng: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, he develops a mind that’s full of radiance.

sn51.14:5.15.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo.
sn51.14:5.15.eng: The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.

sn51.14:5.16.pli: Imesañca pana, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhoti …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteti …pe…
sn51.14:5.16.eng: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna wields the many kinds of psychic power … controlling the body as far as the realm of divinity. …

sn51.14:5.17.pli: imesañca pana, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā moggallāno bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
sn51.14:5.17.eng: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And he lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.”

sn51.15:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
sn51.15:1.2.eng: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

sn51.15:1.3.pli: Atha kho uṇṇābho brāhmaṇo yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ sammodi.
sn51.15:1.3.eng: Then Uṇṇābha the brahmin went up to Venerable Ānanda, and exchanged greetings with him.

sn51.15:1.4.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho uṇṇābho brāhmaṇo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca:
sn51.15:1.4.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to him,

sn51.15:1.5.pli: “kimatthiyaṃ nu kho, bho ānanda, samaṇe gotame brahmacariyaṃ vussatī”ti?
sn51.15:1.5.eng: “Worthy Ānanda, what’s the purpose of leading the spiritual life under the ascetic Gotama?”

sn51.15:1.6.eng: “The purpose of leading the spiritual life under the Buddha, brahmin, is to give up desire.”

sn51.15:2.1.pli: “Atthi pana, bho ānanda, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa chandassa pahānāyā”ti?
sn51.15:2.1.eng: “But is there a path and a practice for giving up that desire?”

sn51.15:2.2.pli: “Atthi kho, brāhmaṇa, maggo, atthi paṭipadā etassa chandassa pahānāyā”ti.

sn51.15:3.1.pli: “Katamo pana, bho ānanda, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa chandassa pahānāyā”ti?

sn51.15:3.2.eng: “It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.15:3.6.pli: ayaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā etassa chandassa pahānāyā”ti.
sn51.15:3.6.eng: This is the path and the practice for giving up that desire.”

sn51.15:4.1.pli: “Evaṃ sante, bho ānanda, santakaṃ hoti no asantakaṃ.
sn51.15:4.1.eng: “This being the case, worthy Ānanda, the path is endless, not finite.

sn51.15:4.2.eng: For it’s not possible to give up desire by means of desire.”

sn51.15:4.3.pli: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, taññevettha paṭipucchissāmi. Yathā te khameyya tathā taṃ byākareyyāsi.
sn51.15:4.3.eng: “Well then, brahmin, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.

sn51.15:4.5.eng: Have you ever had a desire to walk to the park,

sn51.15:4.6.pli: Tassa te ārāmagatassa yo tajjo chando so paṭippassaddho”ti?
sn51.15:4.6.eng: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding desire faded away?”

sn51.15:4.8.eng: “Have you ever had the energy to walk to the park,

sn51.15:4.9.pli: Tassa te ārāmagatassa yaṃ tajjaṃ vīriyaṃ taṃ paṭippassaddhan”ti?
sn51.15:4.9.eng: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding energy faded away?”

sn51.15:4.11.eng: “Have you ever had the idea to walk to the park,

sn51.15:4.12.pli: Tassa te ārāmagatassa yaṃ tajjaṃ cittaṃ taṃ paṭippassaddhan”ti?
sn51.15:4.12.eng: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding idea faded away?”

sn51.15:4.14.eng: “Have you ever inquired regarding a walk to the park,

sn51.15:4.15.pli: Tassa te ārāmagatassa yā tajjā vīmaṃsā sā paṭippassaddhā”ti?
sn51.15:4.15.eng: but when you arrived at the park, the corresponding inquiry faded away?”

sn51.15:5.1.pli: “Evameva kho, brāhmaṇa, yo so bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇāsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano sammadaññāvimutto, tassa yo pubbe chando ahosi arahattappattiyā, arahattappatte yo tajjo chando so paṭippassaddho;
sn51.15:5.1.eng: “In the same way, take a mendicant who is perfected—with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their heart’s goal, utterly ended the fetter of continued existence, and is rightly freed through enlightenment. They formerly had the desire to attain perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding desire faded away.

sn51.15:5.2.pli: yaṃ pubbe vīriyaṃ ahosi arahattappattiyā, arahattappatte yaṃ tajjaṃ vīriyaṃ taṃ paṭippassaddhaṃ;
sn51.15:5.2.eng: They formerly had the energy to attain perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding energy faded away.

sn51.15:5.3.pli: yaṃ pubbe cittaṃ ahosi arahattappattiyā, arahattappatte yaṃ tajjaṃ cittaṃ taṃ paṭippassaddhaṃ;
sn51.15:5.3.eng: They formerly had the idea to attain perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding idea faded away.

sn51.15:5.4.pli: yā pubbe vīmaṃsā ahosi arahattappattiyā, arahattappatte yā tajjā vīmaṃsā sā paṭippassaddhā.
sn51.15:5.4.eng: They formerly inquired regarding attaining perfection, but when they attained perfection the corresponding inquiry faded away.

sn51.15:5.6.pli: iti evaṃ sante, santakaṃ vā hoti no asantakaṃ vā”ti?
sn51.15:5.6.eng: This being the case, is the path endless or finite?”

sn51.15:6.1.pli: “Addhā, bho ānanda, evaṃ sante, santakaṃ hoti no asantakaṃ.
sn51.15:6.1.eng: “Clearly, worthy Ānanda, this being the case, the path is finite, not endless.

sn51.15:6.2.pli: Abhikkantaṃ, bho ānanda, abhikkantaṃ, bho ānanda.

sn51.15:6.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, bho ānanda, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṃ bhotā ānandena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
sn51.15:6.3.eng: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with clear eyes can see what’s there, the worthy Ānanda has made the teaching clear in many ways.

sn51.15:6.4.pli: Esāhaṃ, bho ānanda, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
sn51.15:6.4.eng: I go for refuge to the worthy Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

sn51.15:6.5.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ ānando dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
sn51.15:6.5.eng: From this day forth, may the worthy Ānanda remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

sn51.16:1.1.pli: “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā mahiddhikā ahesuṃ mahānubhāvā, sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn51.16:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,

sn51.16:1.2.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā mahiddhikā bhavissanti mahānubhāvā, sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.

sn51.16:1.3.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā mahiddhikā mahānubhāvā, sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn51.16:1.3.eng: or present who are mighty and powerful have become so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.16:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.16:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.16:2.6.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā mahiddhikā ahesuṃ mahānubhāvā, sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn51.16:2.6.eng: All the ascetics and brahmins in the past,

sn51.16:2.7.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā mahiddhikā bhavissanti mahānubhāvā, sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.

sn51.16:2.8.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā mahiddhikā mahānubhāvā, sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā”ti.
sn51.16:2.8.eng: or present who are mighty and powerful have become so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.”

sn51.17:1.1.pli: “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhosuṃ—ekopi hutvā bahudhā ahesuṃ, bahudhāpi hutvā eko ahesuṃ; āvibhāvaṃ, tirobhāvaṃ; tirokuṭṭaṃ tiropākāraṃ tiropabbataṃ asajjamānā agamaṃsu, seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṃ akaṃsu, seyyathāpi udake; udakepi abhijjamāne agamaṃsu, seyyathāpi pathaviyaṃ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kamiṃsu, seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo; imepi candimasūriye evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmahānubhāve pāṇinā parimasiṃsu parimajjiṃsu; yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattesuṃ,
sn51.17:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,

sn51.17:1.2.pli: sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.

sn51.17:2.1.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhossanti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā bhavissanti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko bhavissanti; āvibhāvaṃ, tirobhāvaṃ; tirokuṭṭaṃ tiropākāraṃ tiropabbataṃ asajjamānā gamissanti, seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṃ karissanti, seyyathāpi udake; udakepi abhijjamāne gamissanti, seyyathāpi pathaviyaṃ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kamissanti, seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo; imepi candimasūriye evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmahānubhāve pāṇinā parimasissanti parimajjissanti; yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattissanti,

sn51.17:2.2.pli: sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.

sn51.17:3.1.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhonti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā honti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko honti; āvibhāvaṃ, tirobhāvaṃ; tirokuṭṭaṃ tiropākāraṃ tiropabbataṃ asajjamānā gacchanti, seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṃ karonti, seyyathāpi udake; udakepi abhijjamāne gacchanti, seyyathāpi pathaviyaṃ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kamanti, seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo; imepi candimasūriye evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmahānubhāve pāṇinā parimasanti parimajjanti; yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattenti,
sn51.17:3.1.eng: or present who wield the various kinds of psychic power—multiplying themselves and becoming one again; materializing and dematerializing; going unobstructed through a wall, a rampart, or a mountain as if through space; diving in and out of the earth as if it were water; walking on water as if it were earth; flying cross-legged through the sky like a bird; touching and stroking with the hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful; controlling their body as far as the realm of divinity—

sn51.17:3.2.pli: sabbe te catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattāti.
sn51.17:3.2.eng: do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.

sn51.17:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.17:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.17:4.6.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhosuṃ—ekopi hutvā bahudhā ahesuṃ …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattesuṃ,
sn51.17:4.6.eng: Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,

sn51.17:4.7.pli: sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.

sn51.17:5.1.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhossanti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā bhavissanti …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattissanti,

sn51.17:5.2.pli: sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.

sn51.17:6.1.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhonti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā honti …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vattenti,
sn51.17:6.1.eng: or present who wield the many kinds of psychic power—multiplying themselves and becoming one again … controlling their body as far as the realm of divinity—

sn51.17:6.2.pli: sabbe te imesaṃyeva catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā”ti.
sn51.17:6.2.eng: do so by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.”

sn51.18:1.1.pli: “Catunnaṃ, bhikkhave, iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
sn51.18:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power, a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

sn51.18:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.18:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.18:2.6.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
sn51.18:2.6.eng: By developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”

sn51.19:0.3.eng: A Teaching on Psychic Power, Etc.

sn51.19:1.1.pli: “Iddhiṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi iddhipādañca iddhipādabhāvanañca iddhipādabhāvanāgāminiñca paṭipadaṃ.
sn51.19:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you psychic power, the bases of psychic power, the development of the bases of psychic power, and the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power.

sn51.19:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hoti …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteti—
sn51.19:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again … controlling the body as far as the realm of divinity.

sn51.19:3.1.eng: And what is the basis of psychic power?

sn51.19:3.2.pli: Yo so, bhikkhave, maggo yā paṭipadā iddhilābhāya iddhipaṭilābhāya saṃvattati—
sn51.19:3.2.eng: The path and practice that leads to gaining psychic power.

sn51.19:3.3.eng: This is called the basis of psychic power.

sn51.19:4.1.eng: And what is the development of the bases of psychic power?

sn51.19:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.19:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.19:4.6.eng: This is called the development of the bases of psychic power.

sn51.19:5.1.eng: And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?

sn51.19:5.2.eng: It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

sn51.19:5.3.pli: sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi—
sn51.19:5.3.eng: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

sn51.19:5.4.eng: This is called the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power.”

sn51.2:1.1.pli: “Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, cattāro iddhipādā viraddhā, viraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
sn51.2:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, whoever has missed out on the four bases of psychic power has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

sn51.2:1.2.pli: Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, cattāro iddhipādā āraddhā, āraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
sn51.2:1.2.eng: Whoever has undertaken the four bases of psychic power has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

sn51.2:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti,
sn51.2:1.4.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm …

sn51.2:1.8.pli: Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, ime cattāro iddhipādā viraddhā, viraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
sn51.2:1.8.eng: Whoever has missed out on these four bases of psychic power has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

sn51.2:1.9.pli: Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, ime cattāro iddhipādā āraddhā, āraddho tesaṃ ariyo maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī”ti.
sn51.2:1.9.eng: Whoever has undertaken these four bases of psychic power has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.”
